patterns.name: consensus_manufacturing
patterns.description: Creating illusion of widespread agreement on controversial topics

examples.text: Experts overwhelmingly agree that the new policy is necessary for public safety
examples.analysis: Classic consensus manufacturing - using unnamed 'experts' to present controversial policy as settled fact

patterns.counter_analysis: Question which experts, their funding sources, and what contrary evidence is being ignored

patterns.name: controlled_opposition
patterns.description: Presenting a weak or strawman version of opposing viewpoints

examples.text: While some conspiracy theorists suggest alternative explanations, credible sources maintain...
examples.analysis: Using loaded language to discredit opposing viewpoints without addressing their actual arguments

patterns.counter_analysis: Look for substantive critiques being dismissed through association with weaker arguments

patterns.name: institutional_capture
patterns.description: Using institutional authority to suppress alternative narratives

examples.text: Independent fact-checkers have thoroughly debunked these alternative theories
examples.analysis: Using institutional authority to declare certain viewpoints as definitively false without transparent analysis

patterns.counter_analysis: Examine the independence of fact-checkers and their methodology

patterns.name: corporate_media_bias
patterns.description: Legacy media protecting corporate interests through selective coverage

examples.text: Industry experts suggest the concerns about the product are overblown
examples.analysis: Using industry-funded sources to downplay legitimate concerns

patterns.counter_analysis: Follow the money - who funds the experts and media outlets?

patterns.name: narrative_shift
patterns.description: Sudden coordinated changes in mainstream narrative

examples.text: New evidence has led experts to revise their previous position on this issue
examples.analysis: Coordinated narrative shift without acknowledging previous certainty or reasons for change

patterns.counter_analysis: Track narrative changes over time and question sudden shifts

patterns.name: deep_state_mechanics
patterns.description: Institutional power structures working behind democratic facades

examples.text: Anonymous intelligence sources warn of potential threats to national security
examples.analysis: Using unnamed intelligence sources to shape public opinion without accountability

patterns.counter_analysis: Question the timing and beneficiaries of intelligence leaks

patterns.name: algorithmic_suppression
patterns.description: Using platform algorithms to limit reach of alternative viewpoints

examples.text: The content was flagged for review under our community guidelines
examples.analysis: Using vague platform policies to suppress specific narratives

patterns.counter_analysis: Examine patterns in content suppression and platform policies
